edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.interfaces

Interface InternalRequestHeader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GNSCommandInternal, InternalCommandPacket

    public interface InternalRequestHeader
    Author:
    arun This interface captures the information carried in internal requests that may be spawned either by regular multi-step requests or by active requests.

    Implementing classes: InternalCommandPacket.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_TTL
      The default number of TTL hops.

        The default number of TTL hops.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getOriginatingRequestID

        long getOriginatingRequestID()
        Returns:
        The request ID corresponding to the request that originated the active request chain.

      • getOriginatingGUID

        String getOriginatingGUID()
        Returns:
        The querier GUID that originated the active request chain.

      • getTTL

        int getTTL()
        Returns:
        The number of hops remaining before the active request expires.

      • hasBeenCoordinatedOnce

        boolean hasBeenCoordinatedOnce()
        This information is needed to ensure that any request chain involves a coordinated request at most once. Ensuring this invariant makes reasoning about the functional semantics as well as resource usage easier. Not ensuring this invariant can result in deadlocks if a coordinated request spawns another coordinated request for the same name. It is also nontrivial to otherwise ensure that each request in the chain is executed exactly once as coordinated requests involve replicated execution; not ensuring this condition risks an exponential blowup in resource usage with increasing depth. Ensuring this invariant is sufficient (but not necessary) to avoid these problems, so it is a design choice favoring simplicity over flexibility.
        Returns:
        True if any request in this chain was coordinated, false otherwise.
